answers.answer: Because the symptoms follow on eating, you might borrow or buy a glucose meter and test your own blood sugar; or else have the doctor do an OGTT which gives you a sugary drink and then tests your blood sugar over a period of a couple hours. If you have hypoglycemia or diabetes and your doctor just tested randomly or fasting, he might not have picked up your reaction to food.Other possibilities that doctors don't often think of are Chronic Fatigue Syndrome and Depression (which often manifests with physical symptoms as well as sadness, hopelessness, lack of motivation). If you think this might be the case, I would see a therapist who can assess you better than a regular doctor.
